title: Mentions of vulnerability and development indices in the news media
Mentions of vulnerability and development indices in the UNFCCC national communications
authors: Figure 1. Mentions of indices over time in the UNFCCC national communications. In the period from 2000-2014 there were 83 mentions of 15 different indices in 492 national communications. Over half of these (49 mentions) were of the Human Development Index (HDI) with the Human Poverty Index (HPI) and the Coastal Vulnerability Index (CVI) being the second most mentioned (6 each).

title: Top 20 Issues on the International Climate Change Issue Agenda according to the Web
subtitle: This graphic gives a picture of the agenda of international climate change NGOs according to their websites. Adaptation is at the top of the agenda of climate NGOs, with the vulnerability indicators ‘food’ and ‘water’ being addressed as the top two issues, followed by ‘community’ as the third.
authors: Figure 1. Top 18 Issues on the International Climate Change Issue Agenda according to the Web. Source: EMAPS Sprint Amsterdam. Date: 24-28 March 2014.

title: Sectorial Specialisation of OECD member countries.
authors: Figure 1. Sectorial Specialisation of OECD member countries. General view of the Sankey diagram. Donor countries are shown on the left, and sectors funded on the right. title: Two decades of UNFCCC negotiations on mitigation and adaptation, 1995-2013.
authors: Figure 1. Network of terms co-occurring in the same paragraphs of the ENB, Volume 12. Node position is determined by a force vector algorithm (Jacomy et al., forthcoming) bringing together terms directly or indirectly linked, and keeping away terms with fewer co-occurrences. Node size is proportional to their frequency in the corpus. Node color follows the clusters identified by the clustering algorithm. The names of the clusters have been attributed manually. SOURCE_DATE
